item.title: Loyalty Tickets
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:7, topic:457397”]This is useless. How would people obtain the item? Wouldn’t you have to give it to them? Even then, you could just make a command that gives the specified user the title they wanted. You could also make it all automated, like Vote4cash or automatic donations.

This doesn’t even belong in ‘ClickItem.java’, it belongs in ItemDef or ItemDef_2 in your client class, of course client-sided.[/quote]

This Thread was written by a silly goose…

Read full topic

item.title: Loyalty Tickets
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

This is useless. How would people obtain the item? Wouldn’t you have to give it to them? Even then, you could just make a command that gives the specified user the title they wanted. You could also make it all automated, like Vote4cash or automatic donations.

This doesn’t even belong in ‘ClickItem.java’, it belongs in ItemDef or ItemDef_2 in your client class, of course client-sided.

Read full topic

item.title: Loyalty Tickets
item.dc:creator: @ClairtyX ClairtyX
item.description:
@ClairtyX wrote:

I used standard pi items for this feel free to change the ids to your own items if you like
Also I did not add all usertitles feel free to add more.

This only works for people who have done this -> http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=532149.0

What it does: It is a ticket that gives you a loyalty title.

First we want to make the items clickable and give us our title,
Add this to Clickitem.java

[code=java]case 7774:
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
itemDef.itemActions[0] = “Apply”;
itemDef.name = “Lord”;
break;

		case 5021:
		itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
		itemDef.itemActions[0] = "Apply";
		itemDef.name = "Sir";
		break;
		
		case 5023:
		itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
		itemDef.itemActions[0] = "Apply";
		itemDef.name = "Lionheart";
		break;
		
		case 5020:
		itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
		itemDef.itemActions[0] = "Apply";
		itemDef.name = "Bigwig";
		break;
		
		case 5022:
		itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
		itemDef.itemActions[0] = "Apply";
		itemDef.name = "Duderino";
		break;
		
		case 620:
		itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
		itemDef.itemActions[0] = "Apply";
		itemDef.name = "Count";
		break;
		
		case 619:
		itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
		itemDef.itemActions[0] = "Apply";
		itemDef.name = "Big Cheese";
		break;
		
		case 7776:
		itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
		itemDef.itemActions[0] = "Apply";
		itemDef.name = "Bandito";
		break;
		
		case 7775:
		itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
		itemDef.itemActions[0] = "Apply";
		itemDef.name = "King";
		break;[/code]

I know this is really easy, it’s just to help the beginners

100% Credits To Me.

Read full topic
